review_title: Good game has low storage requirements

no fun at all just you get spammed with music which isnt even good for this game or even make a good vibe

review_title: Quite fun, despite lacking a few things
one_reviews_text: great fun!  Can't wait for CD2!!!!
Very simple game with lots of rock bashing [as you would expect], however the mines can get boring, and there isn't a lot of new content you get after around 40 minutes of play. Still fun however.

It's fun, but there is no menu or instructions. Kinda "here's a pickaxe, start swingin' it, kid." There are lots of subtle tips if you listen to the guy on the radio. The people on the radio are very good. Lots of story to listen to. Overall, it's an alright game. Pick it up when it's on sale. The rundown:
+ good voice work
+ simple rock bashing fun
+ lots of pretty things to pick up
+ can upgrade the town and tools
- no tool tips or brief explanation for town upgrades, tools, etc
- no instructions, tutorial, or menu
- some clipping issues; Get stuck on objects or Mimi (who is frequently at your hip), so you have to lean or step aside to get unstuck

review_title: I'm not sure how deep train takes me but
one_reviews_text: I will be diggin tunnels and waiting for Digger 2.

review_title: its a great game and its funny
one_reviews_text: i played it for a couple of hour and loved it but i did find a problem with the magnet gun or watever it is. so when i got the magnet gun i was messing aroud with it then suddenly i hear a bunch of clanking and it was the bucket for oil and i relized that the bucket was in moving around in the air when i move the magnet gun but when i used the magnet gun it was under normal gravity again
when i got the game it was fun but it dosent have smooth turing ands its really buggy but still a great game not worth the money though

The game is quite simple, however it still provides endless amounts of fun. I was able to play for hours strait and still felt fine. It does not make you feel sick like some games do after a while. All around it is definitely worth checking the game out for yourself.
fun game

review_title: for those of you with irl space issues
one_reviews_text: if you click in one of the sticks you can teleport around the area, helps if you lack the room to just walk around. otherwise fantastic game, just a little repetitive though

i like this game a lot i dont know what else to say its great but i noticed when i got the game on oculus with the ritches dlc that there was no competitive mode and it woulden't let me get the supporters dlc. are you guys  still working on it or is it just a glitch.

review_title: Risk of injuries or breaking the Touch
one_reviews_text:
This game should not be listed, it is dangerous because it makes you play outside the Guardian fence, I have hit several times the walls and the monitor in front of me because the game area is larger than the fence. Risk of injuries or breaking the Touch is extremely high. 
It should be in the Terms and Conditions for Developers to ensure that safety is taken in consideration.
The game itself is basic, hit the rock, collect the gems before the time is over, buy useless tools and don't use the atomic bomb or otherwise the game is over. There should be an option to enable/disable or decide the length of the timer and also gems which are already in the elevator should not disappear. Not worth the price.

The narration is funny, game looks great too.
Overall a great game, fun for hours under the right circumstances, its so easy to play you can hop in it anytime for a quick VR warmup.
Practice and get to the point where you can harvest whole rooms, oil, special items, set goals for yourself, earn money, collect shineys.
Super fun easer eggs too if you figure out how to use them, mushrooms, LSD trips, geckos in the distance, etc...
Also a great game to show off to VR noobies, its easy to learn and you can pick it up in just a few seconds/minutes, very simple

I wouldn't mind the base mechanics of the game. However, why did they have to put it on a timer. You rush around trying to get all the gemstones and treasure but hardly have time to really use any of the more advanced mining tools. I have about 25 SF of play space and found it pretty inadequate for this game, I kept running into walls and getting tangled in the headset cord as it has you spinning around constantly. After a while I stopped trying to use any of the other tools since I didn't have time to figure them out before I shot back up to the surface so yeah, about 10 minutes using the pickaxe, buying the rest of the tools you won't have time to use and collecting the glove pieces from Avengers Infinity war.

The idea behind the game is very simple, but it works for me. Awesome graphics and very well fit for small rooms. 
I got impressed when i discovered that the pickaxe actually meassures the strength you use to hit the rocks, and I love it. Had a lot of fun breaking those walls.
I didnt feel motion sickness at all, which is very nice in a VR game. After an hour playing It feels a bit repetitive but its good as a party game with friends.  
All in all, awesome graphics, great food (mushrooms) and a good chance to free some energy and sweat.
WAITING FOR SOME NEW CONTENT ;)

review_title: Fun experience, not worth the price tag
one_reviews_text:
EDIT: Since my review was the first and is at the top, let me update by saying that some of the reviewers below have suggested that the bugs I hit may have been patched.

A fun and whimsical mining experience that the developers have obviously enjoyed making. Unfortunately with how short it is and how many bugs I encountered on my short journey - and especially considering some of the other content that is out there for the same price (1900 JPY for me) - I can't recommend it for the cost. Remember though, this is an expansion to a free version that is available on steam, so try it there if you think it might be something you are interested in.

I've given the game 3 stars, as I got a free key from the developers, and it was a fun experience for free. I reached one of the endings within an hour, but there is definitely some room for replay if you want to find all the content.

Below are all minor issues, but my advice to the devs is to work on the controls a bit more. I'm not sure if it was originally vive controls, but the inability to point my index finger made trying to point and grab things from afar very frustrating. It was also difficult to try to slot things into my "belt", so I ended up hanging everything on the walls, but I would have liked to keep things more clutter free by utilizing the belt more.

The controls also bugged out three times during my 1 hour playthrough, and I had to restart the game each time to fix it. One of the bugs was when I held onto a gem as the elevator returned to the surface. The usual symptoms when it is bugging out is that grabbing things doesn't bring them into your hand, and you can only hold onto them for one second or so before they are automatically released. It also prevented me from buying any new items at the store.

To summarize, I think you guys have a good thing going, and although I don't think it is ready for a price tag yet, I look forward to seeing how you improve it in the future!
The game cant even load!

The movement/turning has almost like a weird cooldown that makes that game hard to navigate and not get frustrated with. Especially because you spend the entire game on an elevator and need to turn quickly sometimes like when you manage to get stuck in the corner of the elevator and all you can see is the empty wall. The price isn't fully worth it either.

review_title: MAMA, I AM A DIGGER NOW!
one_reviews_text:
First I had a bit rough time to sort out things with the controllers but after I used to that I dig the hell out of it! IT'S TOTALLY WORTH THE MONEY AND I'M LOVING IT! 

I enjoyed the environment and especially mushrooms :D  The tools are funny, you don't just dig around- you also come up to solve some mysteries and game has a really sick humour ( You will understand what I say when you reach one of the endings :D)  

Can't wait to see what else the devs will bring the game! 
I recommend you to play this with your friends :)
Neat concept, but the turning controls could use a bit of work.   They only seem to work like 30% of the time.

review_title: Doesn't live up to the expectations
one_reviews_text:
First startup of this game and you're thrown right into the shaft elevator below ground. You start hacking away on the rocks, but quickly change your technique to spasming you hand back and forth. You know, for effiency.


There is some fun oddities, a mystery door that needs keys and several endings.

Too bad the game started bugging, items flying all over the place, getting stuck behind a board on the elevator or lost completely. 

I kinda expected more out of this. I see how much work that was put into this, but it doesn't live up.

I had a great time smashing my virtual picaxe against the rocks. You get to unlock/buy loads of different tools which I found enjoyable. 
My criticism is that there were a lot of bugs. 
For example, there are some areas around your waist where you can hand your tools, but some of mine ended up inside my RL body and I couldn't reach them. Also, the turning around system only worked some of the time, so often I was left racing the wrong direction.

A good game, but needs some polish!

Gameplay
The game is in its core about breaking rocks in the mine to get valuables to sell for buying tools and progressing by finding special objects in the mines (no spoiler what things but they're linked with game endings). There’s many tools to buy from a shop. You can for example whack your way through with a pickaxe, buy dynamite and blow rocks apart or punch your way through to gold, gems and fossils like old iconic Nokia phone (yes the one with legendary Snake). There’s more enigmatic objects hidden in the game world so it involves a bit of a mystery-solving too.

Competitive mode
There’s a separate comp mode alongside a normal mode. Haven't done the comp mode much yet but looks like it’s about ten levels mining run with all the tools at your disposal and try to mine maximum amount in given time. Then the lift takes you back up to the surface to see if you could make it to the leaderboards.

Endings, replay value
There’s seven endings in total of which I have found four now. Without wanting to spoil the endings, one was pretty obvious. You’d probably guess before “doing the thing”. Others then came totally out of the blue. The devs announced that they’ll release new content for next Halloween for free. Props to devs, not that many do that anymore these days without slapping a price tag on it. All in all, the game has great amount of replay value in endings and if you’d like to take mining challenge in the competitive mode, you’ll get many hours more. I can also see potential in CD:R for a party game because of its short rounds and entertaining gameplay. Also the game is family-friendly should you play it with family.

Why I deducted a star
I found a few bugs but not any game-breaking with my about five hours of gameplay so far unlike the other reviewer had faced. Maybe devs have patched them. I agree that the tool belt is useless because using it tends to end up in a hassle so instead I use the hanging hooks to organize tool arsenal. -1 star because those.

review_title: Good game, just needs more polishing!
one_reviews_text: Game works now after Dev. suggestion and contacting oculus support. A few bugs here and there but it's a good game :)
review_feedback: Hello, sorry to hear about your trouble. You can resolve this problem by deleting the file "AudioPluginOculusSpatializer.dll" from directory Steam\steamapps\common\Cave Digger\CaveDigger_Data\Plugins.

one_reviews_text: Very good game! Really fun!
